author: Heidi Vogt
title: EPA’s $43,000 Phone Booth for Scott Pruitt Broke the Law, Watchdog Says
text:
WASHINGTON—A $43,000 soundproof phone booth for Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt violated the law, a government oversight body said Monday, because the agency didn’t notify Congress before making the purchase.

The finding, by the Government Accountability Office, comes as Mr. Pruitt has come under fire for his spending on items such as first-class air travel at taxpayer expense.
